page.title: 05Customs-Bolton by Bowland
page.content: Many events have become customs shared by Bolton and Holden.In March a {village concert}is very popular with children and adults taking part.Holden Chapel has its anniversary in May and {St.Peter and Paul Sports}are held in Bolton at the end of June.All the competitors and spectators process to the church for a short service before the sports on the green,tea and a fancy dress contest.Every June{gipsies stop on the way to Appleby Fair.The church has a Harvest Festival in September after which the gifts are auctioned. At{Holden Chapel}the children recite and sing. In October the fortnightly pheasant and duck shoot begins in Bolton Park. At {Christmas}there are parties for the village children and pensioners,carol singing round the farms and a trip to the pantomime in the town.
